Pullback of U.S. troops from S. Korea urged
articles.content:
Pullback of U.S. troops from S. Korea urged
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) - The headquarters of the People's Movement for the Withdrawal of the U.S. Forces released a statement on December 7 demanding the withdrawal of the U.S. troops from South Korea, according to a news report.
 The statement accused the U.S. Forces stationed in South Korea of making desperate efforts to stay in this land even after Korea's reunification, adding that the people are urging the pullback of the U.S. Forces as their presence in South Korea is unreasonable.    
 Noting that the "government" should pursue the policy representing the will of the people, the statement demanded it to abandon the past stand of insisting on the continued U.S. military presence while regarding the people's anti-U.S. spirit as negative.

North side's delegation leaves for inter-Korean panel meeting 
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The north side's delegation left here on Tuesday to participate in the first law-making panel meeting for north-south economic cooperation due in Seoul.
 It was seen off at the airport by Pak Chang Ryon, chairman of the north side to the north-south committee for the promotion of economic cooperation who is first vice-chairman of the State Planning Commission, Jong Un Op, chairman of the National Economic Cooperation Federation, and other officials concerned.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Burkina Faso
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Burkina Faso
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, yesterday sent a message of greetings to Blaise Compaore, President of Burkina Faso, on the occasion of its National Day.
 Kim, in the message, expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam meets new Indonesian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam meets new Indonesian Ambassador
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from new Indonesian Ambassador to the DPRK Hendrati Sukendar Munthe at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there was Vice Foreign Minister Kim Yong Il.    
 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.
